title: Basics of Human Immunity
content: The immune system protects the body from infections using white blood cells, antibodies, and physical barriers like skin and mucous membranes.

title: Balanced Diet Essentials
content: A balanced diet includes proteins, carbohydrates, fats, vitamins, minerals, and water. It supports growth, energy production, and overall health.

title: Hypertension Overview
content: Hypertension is a chronic condition in which blood pressure remains consistently high, increasing risks of heart attack and stroke.

title: First Aid for Burns
content: Cool minor burns under running water for 20 minutes, avoid ice, and apply a sterile dressing. Severe burns require immediate medical care.

title: Mental Health Awareness
content: Mental health includes emotional and psychological well-being. Common disorders include anxiety and depression, which benefit from early treatment.

title: Type 2 Diabetes Basics
content: Type 2 diabetes occurs when the body becomes resistant to insulin, often due to lifestyle, genetics, and physical inactivity.

title: Importance of Hydration
content: Proper hydration supports digestion, metabolic function, temperature regulation, and brain performance.

title: Common Cold Symptoms
content: The common cold causes coughing, runny nose, sneezing, and mild fever. Most cases resolve within 7–10 days.

title: Role of Sleep in Health
content: Sleep promotes physical healing, memory consolidation, and emotional regulation. Adults need 7–9 hours per night.

title: Human Digestive Process
content: Digestion involves breaking down food into nutrients using the stomach, intestines, and digestive enzymes.

title: Basics of Lung Function
content: Lungs supply oxygen to the body and remove carbon dioxide through the process of respiration.

title: Healthy Skin Care
content: Skin health is maintained through hydration, sun protection, and gentle cleansing to prevent irritation and infections.

title: Basics of Nutrition Labels
content: Nutrition labels help consumers understand serving sizes, calories, and nutrient composition to make informed food choices.

title: Asthma Overview
content: Asthma is a chronic respiratory condition caused by airway inflammation leading to wheezing, coughing, and breathlessness.

title: Vitamin D Importance
content: Vitamin D supports bone health, immune function, and calcium absorption. Sunlight is a primary source.

title: Healthy Heart Habits
content: Heart health improves with regular exercise, a balanced diet, reduced salt intake, and avoiding smoking.

title: Human Circulatory System
content: The circulatory system transports oxygen, nutrients, and hormones using blood vessels and the heart.

title: Anemia Causes
content: Anemia occurs when red blood cells or hemoglobin levels are low, often due to iron deficiency, blood loss, or chronic illness.

title: Stress Management Techniques
content: Stress can be reduced through meditation, exercise, deep breathing, and time management.

title: Calcium for Bone Health
content: Calcium strengthens bones and teeth. Dairy, leafy greens, and fortified foods are common sources.

title: Hand Hygiene Importance
content: Washing hands with soap removes harmful germs and prevents infections like flu and stomach illnesses.

title: COVID-19 Basics
content: COVID-19 is caused by SARS-CoV-2 and spreads through respiratory droplets. Symptoms include fever, cough, and fatigue.

title: Influenza Overview
content: Influenza is a viral infection causing fever, body aches, and cough. Vaccination reduces severe illness.

title: Healthy Vision Practices
content: Regular eye exams, limiting screen time, and good lighting help maintain eye health.

title: Iron-Rich Foods
content: Iron supports red blood cell production. Foods rich in iron include spinach, beans, and red meat.

title: Basics of Blood Donation
content: Blood donation is safe and helps save lives. Donors must meet certain health criteria before donation.

title: Identifying Dehydration
content: Symptoms of dehydration include thirst, dry mouth, dizziness, and decreased urine output.

title: Human Nervous System
content: The nervous system transmits signals through the brain, spinal cord, and nerves to control body functions.

title: Healthy Weight Maintenance
content: Healthy weight is maintained through a balanced diet, portion control, and regular exercise.

title: Protein Importance
content: Protein supports muscle repair, enzyme production, and energy. Common sources include eggs, dairy, and legumes.

title: Basics of Cardiovascular Health
content: Cardiovascular health is achieved through exercise, healthy eating, and avoiding tobacco use.

title: Dental Hygiene Basics
content: Brushing twice daily and flossing help prevent cavities, gum disease, and bad breath.

title: Allergy Overview
content: Allergies occur when the immune system reacts to harmless substances like pollen or dust.

title: Pain Management Basics
content: Pain can be managed through medication, physical therapy, heat therapy, and relaxation techniques.

title: Human Kidney Function
content: Kidneys filter waste from blood and regulate fluid and mineral levels.

title: Healthy Aging Tips
content: Healthy aging involves staying active, eating nutritious foods, and maintaining social connections.

title: Basics of Viruses
content: Viruses are microscopic infectious agents that require a host to reproduce and can cause diseases.

title: Basics of Bacteria
content: Bacteria are single-celled organisms that can be beneficial or harmful depending on the species.

title: Child Nutrition Essentials
content: Children need nutrient-dense foods to support growth, development, and immunity.

title: Human Muscular System
content: The muscular system enables movement through skeletal, smooth, and cardiac muscles.

title: Healthy Breakfast Importance
content: Eating breakfast provides energy, supports concentration, and helps maintain healthy metabolism.

title: Basics of Cholesterol
content: Cholesterol is a fat-like substance needed by the body but can cause heart disease when too high.

title: First Aid for Cuts
content: Clean the wound, apply pressure to stop bleeding, and cover with a sterile bandage.

title: Human Liver Function
content: The liver detoxifies blood, produces bile, and supports metabolism.

title: Benefits of Walking
content: Daily walking supports heart health, weight control, and stress relief.

title: Basics of Immune Boosting
content: Proper sleep, hydration, and balanced nutrition help maintain immune function.

title: Types of Headaches
content: Headaches can be tension, migraine, or cluster types, each with different symptoms and triggers.

title: Human Skeleton Basics
content: The skeleton provides structure, protects internal organs, and supports movement.

title: Food Poisoning Symptoms
content: Food poisoning causes vomiting, diarrhea, fever, and cramps due to contaminated food.

title: Basics of Blood Pressure
content: Blood pressure measures the force of blood against artery walls. Normal levels are around 120/80 mmHg.

title: Healthy Hair Care
content: Healthy hair care includes proper washing, conditioning, and limiting heat and chemical exposure.

title: Human Brain Basics
content: The brain controls thought, memory, movement, and vital bodily functions through neurons.

title: Safe Food Storage
content: Proper storage at safe temperatures prevents bacterial growth and reduces risk of foodborne illness.

title: Basics of Anxiety
content: Anxiety involves excessive worry and physical symptoms like tension, rapid heartbeat, and restlessness.

title: Prenatal Nutrition
content: Pregnant women need folic acid, iron, and balanced nutrition to support fetal growth.

title: Healthy Sleep Routine
content: Consistent sleep schedules improve focus, energy levels, and emotional stability.

title: Basics of Vaccination
content: Vaccines train the immune system to recognize and fight infectious agents.

title: Human Eye Structure
content: The eye includes the cornea, lens, retina, and optic nerve, enabling vision.

title: Healthy Lung Habits
content: Avoiding smoking and staying active help maintain strong lung function.

title: High-Fiber Foods
content: Fiber-rich foods support digestion and heart health. Examples include oats, beans, and fruits.

title: Basics of Metabolism
content: Metabolism converts food into energy to fuel bodily processes.

title: Human Reproductive System
content: The reproductive system includes organs that produce gametes and support reproduction.

title: Basics of Dehydration
content: Dehydration happens when fluid loss exceeds intake, causing fatigue and dizziness.

title: Healthy Snacking
content: Healthy snacks like nuts, fruits, and yogurt support sustained energy and nutrient balance.

title: Basics of Fever
content: Fever is a rise in body temperature often caused by infection as the body fights pathogens.

title: Benefits of Yoga
content: Yoga improves flexibility, reduces stress, and enhances mental well-being.

title: Basics of BMI
content: BMI estimates body fat using height and weight to classify weight categories.

title: Human Endocrine System
content: The endocrine system produces hormones that regulate metabolism, growth, and reproduction.

title: Healthy Hydration Habits
content: Drinking adequate water, especially in hot weather, helps maintain fluid balance.

title: Basics of Antibiotics
content: Antibiotics kill bacteria but not viruses. Overuse can lead to antibiotic resistance.

title: Healthy Joint Care
content: Stretching, regular movement, and proper posture support joint health.

title: Sun Protection Basics
content: Sunscreen and protective clothing reduce risk of sunburn and skin cancer.

title: Basics of Digestion
content: Digestion breaks food into nutrients using mechanical and chemical processes.

title: Human Immune Response
content: The immune response identifies pathogens and produces antibodies to neutralize them.

title: Healthy Blood Sugar Levels
content: Stable blood sugar prevents fatigue and reduces risk of diabetes.

title: Common Food Allergens
content: Common allergens include peanuts, eggs, dairy, wheat, soy, and shellfish.

title: Human Hearing System
content: The ear converts sound waves into electrical signals sent to the brain.

title: Basics of CPR
content: CPR uses chest compressions and rescue breaths to maintain blood flow in cardiac arrest.

title: Healthy Meal Planning
content: Meal planning helps balance nutrients and maintain healthy eating habits.

title: Basics of Stress
content: Stress triggers physical and emotional changes. Chronic stress affects immunity.

title: Importance of Probiotics
content: Probiotics support digestion and gut bacteria balance.

title: Human Skin Layers
content: The skin has three layers: epidermis, dermis, and hypodermis, each serving protective functions.

title: Healthy Posture Tips
content: Proper posture reduces risk of back pain and supports musculoskeletal health.

title: Omega-3 Benefits
content: Omega-3 fatty acids support brain health and reduce inflammation.

title: Basics of Allergic Reactions
content: Allergic reactions involve immune overreaction, causing itching, swelling, or breathing difficulty.

title: Human Blood Composition
content: Blood contains red cells, white cells, platelets, and plasma with essential functions.

title: Healthy Liver Habits
content: Limiting alcohol, staying hydrated, and eating nutrient-dense foods support liver health.

title: Basics of Wound Healing
content: Wound healing includes hemostasis, inflammation, proliferation, and remodeling phases.

title: Importance of Fiber
content: Fiber improves digestion and supports heart and metabolic health.

title: Human Respiratory System
content: The respiratory system enables breathing and gas exchange between lungs and blood.

title: Basics of Immunization
content: Immunization helps protect populations from infectious diseases through controlled exposure.

title: Healthy Pregnancy Tips
content: Good prenatal care includes balanced diet, hydration, vitamins, and regular checkups.
